00025 #ifndef RLE_H
00026 #define RLE_H
00027 
00028 
00029 #include "Types.h"
00030 
00035 class RLE_Data
00036 {
00037 public:
00038     RLE_Data(int len = 0, bool use_diff = true) { setup(len, use_diff); }
00039     
00040     // those constructors are for stl containers
00041     RLE_Data(const RLE_Data & obj)  { setup(obj.m_len, obj.m_use_diff, obj.m_buff); }
00042     RLE_Data &operator=(const RLE_Data &);
00043     
00044     ~RLE_Data();
00045 
00046     const uint8 *Encode(const ArrayOfUInts16 &data, int &outlen, bool &changed);
00047     const uint8 *Encode(const ArrayOfUInts64 &data, int &outlen, bool &changed);
00048     
00049     const uint8 *Decode(const uint8 *data, int len);
00050     void Decode(const uint8 *data, int len, ArrayOfUInts64 &outdata);
00051     
00052     void ResetEncoder();
00053 
00054     // decoder will need access to data
00055     const uint8 *Buffer() const { return m_buff; }
00056     int Size() const    { return m_len; }
00057 
00058 private:
00059     void setup(int len, bool use_diff, uint8 * content = 0);
00060 
00061     // change size of internal buffers
00062     // returns true if size was changed
00063     bool Realloc(int size);
00064 
00065     //
00066     // Encode some raw data
00067     //
00068     // data:    block to encode
00069     // inlen:   number of bytes to encode. May be zero, then data can also be 0.
00070     // outlen:  here the number of encoded bytes gets stored (0 if inlen is 0)
00071     // changed: becomes true if the size has changed or a change in the data occured,
00072     //          so the differential data (before encoding) is not all zero
00073     //
00074     // return:  new buffer with encoded data, must be deleted after use!
00075     //
00076     const uint8 *Encode(const uint8 *data, int inlen, int &outlen, bool &changed);
00077 
00078     // Encode: source data (original or diff in diff mode)
00079     // Decode: store decoded data
00080     uint8 *m_buff;
00081     // Unpacked size
00082     int m_len;
00083     // Use differential encoding
00084     bool m_use_diff;
00085 };
00086 
00087 
00091 class PartFileEncoderData {
00092 protected:
00093     // number of sources for each part for progress bar colouring
00094     RLE_Data m_part_status;
00095     // gap list
00096     RLE_Data m_gap_status;
00097     // blocks requested for download
00098     RLE_Data m_req_status;
00099 
00100 public:
00101     //
00102     // decoder side - can be used everywhere
00103     void DecodeParts(const class CECTag * tag, ArrayOfUInts16 &outdata);
00104     void DecodeGaps(const class CECTag * tag, ArrayOfUInts64 &outdata);
00105     void DecodeReqs(const class CECTag * tag, ArrayOfUInts64 &outdata);
00106 };
